q: "Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti," Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. . It's the economy: Democrats also hammered Republicans for making abortion legislation a major priority early into the new Congress. They accused the GOP of abandoning a campaign pledge to create jobs. I do not understand how this Republican Congress can move from that mandate to create jobs, to create opportunities in this country toward how we undermine women's reproductive health, said Barbara Boxer Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N.Y.). had no legal claim to it. The SCA, which Zahi Hawass heads, said in an email that its request had been approved by both Prime Minister Ahmed Nazif and the Egyptian ministry of culture. This request is a natural consequence of Egypt's long-standing policy of seeking the restitution of all archaeological and historical artefacts that have been taken illicitly out of the country, it said. Zahi Hawass has campaigned to repatriate several pharaonic treasures in recent years, including the Rosetta Stone now in the British Museum. Article: Egypt asks Berlin to return Nefertiti bust... said to Regis Philbin . "I think it's a good idea. I think you're leaving at the top of your game." With David Letterman laughing, Martin Short pressed on with the obvious joke. It's a smart thing to do, because you've peaked, he said. And then he advised David Letterman to not "come back like Sinatra." Though it was inevitable, the humor was lost when David Letterman inevitably set the record straight and Martin Short feigned ignorance.

Senator Chuck Schumer and I are committed to making sure their voice in Washington is as strong as it's ever been.
